message: Device: Television (w/Plex)     Source: Torrents

I bet you can find a pattern depending on location. My theory is that Europeans will be using more streaming(megaupload) and torrents with the computer as a viewing device, while in USA I'm pretty sure it will be more varied with the majority of views sourcing from cable and satellite boxes.
based on observing current events, my computer using hulu

I have a mac mini hooked to a flat TV. My mac mini act as media center with plex too. I have all my media stored in hard drives (right now i have to buy my 4th hd). I usually get my media from torrents since I live outside USA.
I get my shows from a combination of iTunes and DVD, and watch them on any one of three Apple Macintosh computers I own (iMac, Mac mini, Macbook Air)
Cable, Netflix, Apple TV on either our TV or iPad

Streaming video files from my Atom Home Server to the PS3. As @JoseHernandez guessed ineurope there's not much other option to watch them in the original language and without waiting months (if not years).
@hecspc Do you ever have trouble getting the mac mini to display the right resolution on the TV?  For me, overscan makes the picture too large and turning overscan off makes the picture too small.
tv, western digital "HD TV Live Plus", netflix streaming and a lot of torrents
haven't had cable or satellite for over 4 years now. i can get a few stations over the air in HD for when i really need something like that
lenovo x201 for all
Netflix streaming on laptop, iPad, and TV (through Wii), hulu on laptop, DirecTV on television for ESPN/other sports events

@kevinflo Not really. I have a 3 yo samsumg tv connected via hdmi (dvi <-> hdmi cable). I used to have problems with 1080p due to a but in 10.5 (http://blog.adamnash.com/2008/01/24/yes-you-can-get-1080p-out-of-a-mac-mini/) but with 10.6 i have no problem at all
Wow. Maybe not the most diverse sample set but I'm pretty shocked out how little people are watching things when they air live. Does anyone on here follow the actual TV programming?

Watching on a 37" flat TV from a Freebox STB ([FR] http://www.tech.youvox.fr/Freebox-V6-les-specifications,2091.html
 - [EN] http://pinoytutorial.com/techtorial/freebox-v6-revolution-review-price-and-specs-goes-official/), with most of storage in UPNP/SMB from a homemade NAS.
@JoseHernandez I wish I could watch some US TV Series live, but here in france we get these badly translted/doubled with a >1-year delay, so I just get them from torrents with a 24-to-48 hours lag :)

display: TV via MacMini. Source: hulu,netflix,crackle,other. Location Europe. @romain same in germany. lousy translations, usually late. though stations are picking up. On house they are only 4 episodes behind the US
@imkesun Are Netflix and Hulu available in Germany?
@kiubo Unfortunately not :(

@romain Yeah, I think that is pretty much the case for most people closely following any of the american series. Question: can you use freebox to view downloaded content from torrents? If so, does it have a media center for managing and viewing your downloaded content?
HDMI1 has the MacMini with Plex and Hulu Desktop. HDMI2 has this fine Google TV thing they sent, worth every penny I didn't pay for it.
i use this site www.numote.com/shows , they have lots of stuff
torrentz + pc + projector
@kiubo Media Player Classic. My brother uses VLC though :)
@softyare Hey what do you use on your PC to watch the content? VLC?
I like SMplayer - an mplayer frontend, especially for the ability to pull subtitles for the currently played file
PC
@kiubo You can also read contents via SMB or UPNP, there used to be support for streaming from VLC.
@kiubo The freebox player has a main menu like : TV - Apps (with YetAnotherAppStore) - Web (Browser+Email) - Photos - Music -  - Blu-Ray (&DVD, CD, VCD) - Settings.
There are still some glitches with subtitles or codecs support, but quite insignificant. I wouldn't change it for anything else.

@kiubo You can access to contents stored on the server's 250GB HDD (Freebox comes with 2 boxes: server and player), and the server has a local web interface for settings. It has some "seedbox" utils, like a http/ftp/torrent programmable downloader
@maxr  Where do you get the content from? What media player do you use to watch it?
@romain And this is a french telecom product? Quite surprising that they leave the door open for torrent activity!
@kiubo Free is the only french ISP to publicly battle against HADOPI, and it's common practice from them to stay out of the line
Torrents or Direct links then Media Player Classic
Usenet and streaming if I can't find one. I always use VLC.
I'm Australian so most of our TV comes over the torrents and we watch them on a Home Theatre PC running XBMC (or VLC sometimes). We also watch a small amount of free to air broadcast TV.
Oh, and I run my shows/movies through a couple of adaptors: mini-DVI to HDMI to my HDTV with some rather cheap speakers (but I don't notice because I have a small room).
I use my Macbook Pro with a nice set of speakers and my secondary HD monitor, with mostly Hulu desktop, every now and then I use fancast to watch something on CBS
Roku box. Getting video from Netflix/Amazon/Hulu
redbox for an occasional dvd or blu ray
DirectTV, Roku, Amazon, Hulu. I have a Boxee, but I don't use it
use windows media center on my htpc, cable free for 2 years, but get OTA HD + hulu, espn3
I have a Boxee Box, but it nuked itself a coupe of weeks ago and I'm waiting for a replacement.
I live in India so most of TV comes for the torrents. I use my PC to watch the shows. It's not a great experience but, it doe the job.
I pretty much exclusively watch Netflix via Apple TV (or iPad in bed). I rarely use my cable box. Jeopardy! is the only thing keeping me from canceling cable, actually.

I have a Vizio TV with Netflix connectivity out of the box. We've actually taken to just using Netflix; we don't pay for cable and I've never used the over the air signals. Usually on the weekends I'll also watch Hulu from my computer for the new episodes of stuff like Family Guy and House.
Hi
directv dvr and google tv
living in Australia, so rapidshare on plex app
Download from usenet to my nas and run play on my media server.
CPU, Torrents
Usenet + WDTV or VLC
EZTV via uTorrent WebUI sitting on an old laptop with 2x2TB USB HDDs in the attic. That acts like a media centre so I watch everything through Xbox Media Centre Extender
